headline: Soft Pretzel Bites
description: These homemade soft pretzel bites can be customized with any topping and paired with the dipping sauce of your choice!
name: Soft Pretzel Bites
recipeIngredient: 4 cups all-purpose flour, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Place 1 1/2 cups water, butter, brown sugar, yeast, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the hook attachment. Mix until well combined. Let sit for about 5 minutes.

Turn mixer on low speed and add 4 cups flour, 1 cup at a time. Add additional 1/2 cup flour if dough appears sticky. Increase speed to medium and knead until dough is smooth and pulls away from the sides of the bowl, 4 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle in more flour if dough still seems a little tacky.
Oil a large mixing bowl. Add the ball of dough. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a sheet pan with cooking spray.
Bring 3 quarts water to a boil in a large saucepan. Slowly add baking soda and return to a boil.
Meanwhile, remove dough from the bowl, flatten into a disc shape, and cut into 8 wedges. Roll each wedge into a 24-inch rope. Cut each rope into 1-inch pieces.

Drop batches of dough pieces into the boiling water for about 35 seconds. Remove to the prepared sheet pan. Beat egg with 1 tablespoon water; brush over the tops of each boiled dough piece. Repeat with remaining dough.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 14 to 16 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

review.reviewBody: DEFINITELY ADD LESS SALT they’re super salty if you add the full amount. But besides that the texture is perfect and it’s fairly easy! will definitely be repeating!
It was delicious and I will definitely make it again
Great recipie, made it several times. If you want to freeze a bunch - boil them then freeze them. Then you can bake them right out of the freezer.
Made these for our hockey billets and a bunch of their team mates. They were a huge hit!

This is my second attempt ever making pretzels! they actually came out really well despite my shotty work with the sizing haha. Make sure to put lots of salt on top when they're done baking! I baked them for 13 minutes.
